decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers:

Location Plan, Wave 4&5 Proposed 1.3, GET SET HIRE LAYOUT REV 7-663-1F V1.0 Drawing No: 8368R7, 30521/PL/104; 30521-PL-105; 30521-PL-102; 30038-PL-113A; 30038-PL-114C; 30038-PL-116B; 30038-PL-117A; 01 Rev A (Detail Soft Landscape Plan); 02 Rev A (Soft Landscape Sections); 03 Rev A received 16/05/2013. C11208/SK010 and 30038-PL-112E

Reason: In the interests of proper planning and to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building in accordance with the details supplied under application reference PP/2013/1800 dated 19/11/2013 and those identified in the schedule of external facing materials detailed on the approved drawings within Condition 2 above.

Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate for the development and to safeguard the character of the area in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The proposed hard and soft landscaping works shall be implemented in accordance with the details shown on drawings 01 Rev A (Detail Soft Landscape Plan) and 02 Rev A (Soft Landscape Sections) received 16th May 2013 prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that a high quality scheme is implemented in order to safeguard the character and appearance of the area and designated Green Corridor, in accordance with policies G5 and G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The boundary treatment shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved under application reference PP/2014/3224 dated 12/08/2014 and fully completed prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the area, in the interests of highway safety and crime prevention, in accordance with policies T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), and policies 7.3, 7.4 and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The proposed provision for refuse and recycling storage for the development shall be provided in accordance with the details contained within the application and on the approved drawings prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted, and shall be retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that adequate facilities refuse and recycling facilities are provided for the development, in accordance with policy SI8 of the London Plan 2021. | The parking spaces, service bays and cycle storage areas (including disabled parking) identified on the drawing number 30038-PL-112B received 02/09/2013 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation/use of the relevant part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for the life of the development and shall not be used for any other purpose unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking and servicing provision within the site, in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan (2021), policy 6.13 of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The Electric Vehicle Charging Points shall be installed and available prior to the first occupation of the relevant part of the development in accordance with the details approved under permission PP/2-014/3225 dated 15.07.2014 and thereafter maintained for the life of the development.

Reason: To ensure that vehicle charging facilities are provided within the site, in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan (2021). | No structure or erection exceeding 0.6m metres in height shall be placed within the site access visibility splays identified on drawing number C11208/SK010 received 02/09/2013 September 2013. The visibility splays shall thereafter be retained for the life of the development.

Reason: In the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policy T6 of the London Plan 2021 and policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The Delivery and Servicing Plan shall be implemented and the site shall be managed in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2014/3226 dated 15/07/2014 and shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policies T3, T4 and T7 of the London Plan (2021), and policy 6.13 of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved construction logistics plan in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2013/5153 dated 08/01/2014. Such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of construction, in accordance with policies T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | Any damage to the adopted highway resulting from the construction of the development shall be repaired under s278 Agreement with the relevant highway authority at the cost of the developer.

Reason: To safeguard existing transport infrastructure. | No impact piling shall take place until a piling method statement (detailing the type of piling to be undertaken and the methodology by which such piling shall be carried out, including measures to minimise the potential for damage to subsurface water or sewerage infrastructure, and the programme for the works) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the relevant water or sewerage undertaker. Any piling must be undertaken in accordance with the terms of the approved piling method statement unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: The proposed works would be in close proximity to underground water and sewerage utility infrastructure. | The approved contamination assessment shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2013/5208 dated 08/01/2014 prior to the construction of the development. The Council's Regulatory Services must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.

Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous in the interest of public health and safety, in accordance with policies 5.21 and 7A of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | The BREEAM Very Good standard shall be retained in working order for the life of the development and in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2015/2174 dated 24/06/2015.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021) and adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012). | The development shall be constructed fully incorporating the approved energy details in accordance with the details approved under permission reference PP/2013/5209 dated 07/08/2014. Such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021) and the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012). | Upon final completion of the development and prior to occupation, suitable devices for monitoring the renewable/low-carbon energy equipment shall be installed. The monitored data shall be submitted to the local planning authority at daily intervals for a period of three years from final completion of the relevant part of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The installation of the monitoring devices shall be in a compatible format and the submission of the data shall be carried out in accordance with the Council's approved specifications as indicated in Automated Energy (& CO2) Monitoring Platform [AEMP] document.

Reason: To monitor the effectiveness of the renewable/low carbon energy equipment in order to confirm compliance with energy policies and establish an evidence base on the performance of such equipment.

| Notwithstanding the provision of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 2020 (or any order revoking and re-enacting the Order with or without modification), The terrace of five industrial units hereby approved shall only be used for purposes within Use Classes B1 (E(g)), B2 and/or B8 and for no other purpose within the said Order except with the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To restrict the use of the premises to those compatible with the site's designation and the design and layout of the development, in accordance with policies E7, T3 and T4 of the London Plan (2021), and policies 6.13, 7A and 7B of the Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition 2 (approved plans) and remove condition 19 (floor space), seeking to allow the creation of a mezzanine floor to each unit, pursuant to planning permission Ref: PP/2013/1800 dated 19/11/2013 (as varied by Ref: PP/2015/4054 dated: 20.11.2015, Ref: 161042OPDFUL dated: 22.02.2017, Ref: 163146OPDC2 dated: 21.09.2017) for 'Redevelopment of site to provide car showroom and workshop including MOT facilities, valet, wash and plant (Sui generis use) and terrace of industrial/warehouse units (flexible B1/B2/B8 use) with associated access, parking servicing and landscaping
